Classical.Structure: The 'What' pathway. Extends from the primary visual cortex (V1) to the inferior temporal lobe.
Classical.Function: Processes object recognition, form, and color. Identifies 'what' an object is (e.g., 'a face', 'a cup').
Classical.Pathology: Visual agnosia (inability to recognize objects), prosopagnosia (inability to recognize faces).

SCPN.L2_NeurochemicalNeurological: Processes high-spatial-frequency visual information (parvocellular pathway) to build complex object representations.
SCPN.L4_CellularTissueSynchronisation: Formalizes tissue-level dynamics via phase-coupled oscillators, quasicritical operation (Griffiths regimes), and multi-path coupling (gap junctions, ephaptic fields, glial/vascular slow control). Models entrainment to cosmological rhythms (Schumann, lunar) via biophotons and cryptochromes.
SCPN.L5_OrganismalPsychoemotional: Provides the L5 self-model with the 'meaning' of the visual world. Attaches semantic labels and emotional valence to perceived objects.
SCPN.L7_ArchetypalSymbolic: This pathway links visual input to the L7 symbolic/archetypal layer, allowing a 'rose' to be recognized not just as a flower, but as a 'symbol of love'.
SCPN.L9_MemoryHolograph: Cross-references visual input with L9 memory to identify objects. This is the 'lookup' function.

Symbolic.MetaphysicalMapping: The 'semantic engine' that attaches meaning and identity to raw perception. It translates the 'image' on the screen (V1) into a 'concept'.

Falsification_Hypotheses: Lesions to the ventral stream will impair spatial navigation, but not object recognition.
Neurons in the fusiform face area (FFA) will fire equally for faces and houses.
Experimental_Protocols: fMRI or single-unit recording during object or face recognition tasks.
Simulation_Suite: Model a deep convolutional neural network (CNN) to simulate the hierarchical feature extraction of the ventral stream.
